The product(s) is the product(s), the business is the business, the stock is the stock - each require dedicated analysis (and each can also influence the others)  but IMO for all 3 over the LT to win, you need "true believer", visionary, and focused leadership...  FB has that.

From strictly a business perspective, FB has the advantage that Suckberg has only 1 wife: FB. So he can focus exclusively on his one wife's needs.  Jack, unfortunately has 2 wives: Square + Twitter. Jack is a polarizing figure, but IMO many/most of the hate is rooted is in this.

I've witnessed this firsthand - and also researched it. TWTR has made mistakes, but I believe TWTR's inherent DNA + mission is to cultivate freedom of expression, expand the open flow of ideas/information/relationships.   FB's is not. I don't find that acceptable, that's just me.

both twtr + fb have their flaws as social networks - not going to delve into that. but IMHO - as user of twtr since 2009, and (former) user of FB since 2006...  I truly + deeply believe FB is a real threat to civil liberties, free speech, & the open exchange/flow of ideas+info.

my personal feelings aside, the risk is that twtr fails at this noble + ambitious endeavor: slaying the evil Goliath, aka FB.   that it becomes something like a Yahoo over time.  I don't see that as the case for TWTR just yet - I see key differences vs YHOO- but that is the risk.

FB is the evil empire of social, & twitter is something else. Twitter offers a competing, different - and in my opinion - superior present reality and vision for what social should and can be.  The uber long term bull case for twitter is that it does to FB what APPL did to MSFT.

Facebook vs twitter today remind me of Microsoft vs Apple in the 80s-90s: MSFT, the evil empire, APPL the quirky, niche boutique w/ an incredibly loyal fanbase of misfits, troublemakers, round pegs in the square holes.  the evil empire's relative dominance lasted for a long time.

Some of you have asked me what I think about twitter. I provided some analysis, but left out my personal take. Here it is:  I hate facebook, wouldn't mind seeing $FB disappearing from the face of the earth. I want to see twitter and its vision for social win, long term.  thread
